metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12100 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Dovecot before 2.3.11.3, uncontrolled recursion in submission, lmtp, and lda allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via a crafted e-mail message with deeply nested MIME parts.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12100` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-auth-lua - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-core - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-lucene - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-solr - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
dovecot-submissiond - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> marking precise as ignored since we won't fix it version in that release is quite old and the backports could possibly cause serious regressions.

criterions.comment: dovecot package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.2').
